description: Change of use of a single dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to a Large House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) (Use Class Sui Generis) comprising 12 bedrooms (maximum 12 person occupancy) for a temporary period of four years; and provision of associated bike storage and refuse/recycling bins (Retrospective Application)
decision_conditions: This permission shall be for a limited period of 48 months (4 years) expiring on (date tbc upon finalisation of S106) when the use (subject to this consent) shall be discontinued.
Reason: To ensure that the use is temporary in nature in accordance with the permission given.
2. The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers:

CP/2019/18/02_Rev 1 (Site Layout Plan), CP/2019/18/03_Rev 1 (Existing and Proposed Plans-Lower Ground and Ground Floor), CP/2019/18/04_Rev 1 (Existing and Proposed Plans-First, Second and Third Floor),   CP/2019/18/05_Rev 1 (Existing and Proposed Front and Rear Elevation), CP/2019/18/06_Rev 1 (Existing and Proposed Side Elevations), CP/2019/18/07_Rev 1 (Existing and Proposed Section),  CP/2019/18/08_Rev 1 (Refuse and Cycling Plan).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
3. The house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than twelve (12) rooms and twelve (12) occupants.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.
4.  Within (1) month of the date of this permission, cycle parking for 14no. bicycles shall be implemented in accordance with the London Plan Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage and disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
5. Within (1) one month of the date of this permission, the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be implemented in accordance with Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.

6. The land shall be used for House of Multiple Occupation and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in class Sui Generis of the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification) for the life of this permission (i.e. 48 months).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4, 7B and 7C policies 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).
